attributes.action: To eliminate misleading parking signs from london roads
attributes.additional_details:
There a few of them in tooting Totterdown street sw17  8tb london one board gives three different instruction and are not the same size,other contradict them completely,
Our mp are aware of them in fact they took photos to escalate the issue with local authorities but nothing is done and motorist getting ticket every day
attributes.background: I find some parking instruction signs are misleading the motorist and too many of them causes confusion and trap motorist instead of deterring them

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Parking and the signs associated with it are the responsibility of your local council. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: 

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors 

If your concern is specifically about Tooting, you could also petition your local council - you can find out more here: http://www.wandsworth.gov.uk/info/200315/have_your_say/910/petitions_to_the_council
